ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] EQ2, or perhaps not....
ygData.msgSnippet: I think Neverwinter nights sounds good but it will be difficult if you don t know people since the games will be invites to people who know one another.  I
ygData.messageBody:
I think Neverwinter nights sounds good but it will be difficult if you don't know people since the games will be invites to people who know one another.  I know a lot of EQ people want to play it so if you have friends from Norrath you might have no trouble getting set up there.  I'm just not sure how people who aren't going in fully friended will get into good games.
 
I think Shadowbane sounds great since what happens in the world and on the servers actually changes them.   For example, if your guild takes over a city then it doesn't just repop back to its old self.  The world itself changes. 
 
I don't know much about Camelot but it looks interesting as well.
 
Personally, I have joined SCA and am much more interested in real life play than on-line play right now.  I may have to check them out, but I don't ever want to get re-addicted to a fantasy environment.  Real life is SO much more interesting :-)
 
Ice
----- Original Message -----
From: ea9999@...
To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, February 09, 2001 3:19 AM
Subject: [EQ_women] EQ2, or perhaps not....

In the previous thread, noone addressed the question of whether they
planned to play any of the upcoming online games. I don't know too
much about them, but there seem to be some interesting ones, like
Neverwinter Nights, which will not be massively multiplayer, but
allow you to adventure with a few friends like AD&D, or  Shadowbane
(sounds to PK-friendly to me) and Dark Age of Camelot. I know there
are others, including futuristic ones. And then, of course, there is
EQ2.

Does anyone know anything about them? Anyone in the betas?

Love, Liz

aka Gyngermynx, Ranger of Tunare, 37 seasons now, Quellious
